column4: sudo dpkg-reconfigure linux-image-$(uname -r) reconfigures the last kernel image in the system?
what does "sudo dpkg-reconfigure linux-image-$(uname -r)" do?
It reconfigures the kernel, so that involves making a new "initrd" a file used at boot, and rewriting the grub menu.lst file (in case you added a new kernel)
